intro: Hieracium molucratum, commonly known as the Moluccan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium molucratum is often found in humid tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in rich, organic soil.
